description: Difference between the smallest number S(n) with S(n)! a multiple of n and the largest prime factor of n [taking a(1)=0].
references: S. R. Finch, Mathematical Constants, Cambridge, 2003, pp. 284-292.
links: S. R. Finch, The Average Value of the Smarandache Function
example: a(12)=1 since 12 is a factor of 4!, 3 is the largest prime factor of 12 and 4-3=1
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Aug 08 2000
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Aug 22 2000
